revised_title: Researches on Chrysaniline: A New Yellow Colouring Matter Derived from Coal-Tar
tldr: The author investigates chrysaniline, a yellow colouring matter derived from coal-tar, and its various salts. Chrysaniline is a triamine closely related to rosaniline and leucaniline, differing only in the amount of hydrogen they contain. The author describes the properties, synthesis, and analysis of chrysaniline and its salts, including the mononitrate, dinitrate, and hydrochlorate.
